conbody.p: The following prerequisites apply to Network Explorer:

section.title: Required User Roles

p.b: To execute searches in Network Explorer, you must have a user account with one of the following roles:

ul.li:
Custom role with Network Explorer Search capabilities (To search for Managed Objects or node names)
Resource: topologySearchService, Operation: read
Resource: searchExecutor, Operation: read
Resource: modelInformationService, Operation: read

Custom role with Network Explorer Search and Collection capabilities (To search for Collections, Saved Searches, Managed Objects or node names)
Resource: topologySearchService, Operation: read
Resource: searchExecutor, Operation: read
Resource: modelInformationService, Operation: read
Resource: Collections_Public, Operation: read
Resource: Collections_Private, Operation: read
Resource: SavedSearch_Public, Operation: read
Resource: SavedSearch_Private, Operation: read
Resource: CollectionsOthers_Public, Operation: read
Resource: SavedSearchOthers_Public, Operation: read

p.b: To create, read, update or delete Collections and Saved Searches in Network Explorer you must have a user account with one of the following roles:

ul.li:
Custom role with Collections and Saved Searches capabilities (To perform create, read, update or delete operations on Collections and Saved Searches)
Resource: topologySearchService, Operation: read
Resource: searchExecutor, Operation: read
Resource: modelInformationService, Operation: read
Resource: Collections_Public, Operation: create
Resource: Collections_Private, Operation: create
Resource: SavedSearch_Public, Operation: create
Resource: SavedSearch_Private, Operation: create
Resource: Collections_Public, Operation: read
Resource: Collections_Private, Operation: read
Resource: CollectionsOthers_Private, Operation: read
Resource: CollectionsOthers_Public, Operation: read
Resource: SavedSearch_Public, Operation: read
Resource: SavedSearch_Private, Operation: read
Resource: SavedSearchOthers_Private, Operation: read
Resource: SavedSearchOthers_Public, Operation: read
Resource: Collections_Public, Operation: update
Resource: Collections_Private, Operation: update
Resource: CollectionsOthers_Public, Operation: update
Resource: CollectionsOthers_Private, Operation: update
Resource: SavedSearch_Public, Operation: update
Resource: SavedSearch_Private, Operation: update
Resource: SavedSearchOthers_Private, Operation: update
Resource: SavedSearchOthers_Public, Operation: update
Resource: Collections_Public, Operation: delete
Resource: Collections_Private, Operation: delete
Resource: CollectionsOthers_Public, Operation: delete
Resource: CollectionsOthers_Private, Operation: delete
Resource: SavedSearch_Public, Operation: delete
Resource: SavedSearch_Private, Operation: delete
Resource: SavedSearchOthers_Private, Operation: delete
Resource: SavedSearchOthers_Public, Operation: delete

p.b: To view an object's attributes in Network Explorer you must have a user account with one of the following roles:

ul.li:
Custom role with Network Explorer search or Collections capabilities to select an object in Network Explorer. These capabilities are listed above. You will also need the following capabilities to view attributes:
Resource: modelInformationService, Operation: read
Resource: persistentobjectservice, Operation: read

p.b: To edit an object's attributes in Network Explorer you must have a user account with one of the following roles:

ul.li:
Custom role with Network Explorer search or Collections capabilities to select an object in Network Explorer. These capabilities are listed above. You will also need the following capabilities to view or edit attributes:
Resource: modelInformationService, Operation: read
Resource: persistentobjectservice, Operation: read
Resource: persistentobjectservice, Operation: update

section.p: Note: Refer to the User Management User Guide for instructions on creating a user/role and setting a password.

section.title: Target Based Access Control (TBAC)
section.p: TBAC is an authorization mechanism that restricts access to the targets (Nodes) assigned.

When TBAC is enabled, only the nodes defined in the user permissions (refer to the Target Group Management User Guide for more information) are accessible. This can affect the results of searches and collections contents, causing different users to get different results based on their assigned targets.
